# FINE ART (Paintings)

\vspace{0.3cm}

1.  Albert Eckhout, *Series of eight figures* (1641)

    -   [painting
        1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Albert_Eckhout_-_Mameluca.JPG)
    -   [painting
        2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Albert_Eckhout_painting.jpg)
    -   [painting 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:MulatoAE.jpg)
    -   [painting
        4](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Albert_Eckhout_Tapuia_woman_1641.jpg)

For more and context [see this](https://www.khanacademy.org/humanities/art-americas/new-spain/colonial-brazil/a/albert-eckhout-series-of-eight-figures) -->

2.  Albert Eckhout, *Brazilian Fruits* (c. 1610): [link
    here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Albert_Eckhout_1610-1666_Brazilian_fruits.jpg)

3.  Balthasar van der Ast, *Fruit, Flowers, and Shells* (1620/1629):
    [link here](http://emuseum.toledomuseum.org/objects/55093)

4.  Johanne Zoffany, *The Death of Captain James Cook* (1779): [link
    here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Death_of_Captain_James_Cook_(Zoffany)#/media/File:Zoffany_Death_of_Captain_Cook.jpg)

5.  Thomas Cole, *Expulsion from the Garden of Eden* (1828): [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/expulsion-from-the-garden-of-eden/IQEPipHQTghvCw?hl=en)

6.  Thomas Cole, *The Garden of Eden* (1828): [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/the-garden-of-eden-thomas-cole/FwHRDrYYX_YVuw)

7.  Frederic Edwin Church, *The Heart of the Andes* (1859): [link
    here](https://www.metmuseum.org/art/collection/search/10481).

    -   There's an audio link on the page that gives a great
        explanation. You can also read more [link
        here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Heart_of_the_Andes)

8.  Charles Christian Nahl, *Incident on the Chagres River* (1867):
    [link
    here](http://imgzoom.cdlib.org/Fullscreen.ics?ark=ark:/13030/tf658010cs/z1&&brand=oac4)

9.  Martin Johnson Heade, *Hummingbird with Passionflowers* (c. 1875):
    [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/hummingbird-and-passionflowers-martin-johnson-heade/LAEr7eIcfErZwg?hl=en)

10. Paul Gauguin, *Arearea* (1892): [link
    here](https://www.wikiart.org/en/paul-gauguin/arearea-i-1892)

11. Paul Gauguin, *Tahitian Landscape* (1891): [link
    here](./texts_images/paintings/gauguin_tahitian_landscape.jpeg)

<!-- Note that Gauguin [was an exploitative colonialist in his own right](https://www.dailyartmagazine.com/gauguin-master-or-monster/).  -->

12. Henri Rousseau, *The Dream* (1910): [link
    here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Henri_Rousseau#/media/File:Henri_Rousseau_-_Le_R%C3%AAve_-_Google_Art_Project.jpg).

    -   After you've written your answers, put on some headphones and
        [take a guided tour through the
        painting](https://artsandculture.google.com/story/xwVxpOh7XnK4bQ)).

13. Henri Rousseau, *The Equatorial Jungle* (1909): [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/the-equatorial-jungle-henri-rousseau/cwFWCSzNtFX8ew)

14. Perham Nahl, *Thirteenth Labor of Hercules* (1915): [link
    here](https://www.artsy.net/artwork/perham-wilhelm-nahl-the-thirteenth-labor-of-hercules-official-poster-for-the-panama-pacific-international-exposition)

15. Lasar Segall, *Menino com lagartixas* (1924): [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/menino-com-lagartixas-lasar-segall/lAEC6kbwDCYW_A)

16. Candido Portinari *Brazilian Flora and Fauna* (1934): [link
    here](https://artsandculture.google.com/asset/brazilian-flora-and-fauna/dQFZBwYjfMCjsA)

17. Wilfredo Lam, *The Jungle* (1943): [link
    here](https://www.wikiart.org/en/wifredo-lam/the-jungle-1943).

    -   The MOMA site also includes some [links to
        audio](https://www.moma.org/collection/works/34666) where you
        can learn more about Lam and his work.

18. Wilfredo Lam, *Le Sombre Malembo, Dieu du carrefour* (1943): [link
    here](https://www.wikiart.org/en/wifredo-lam/le-sombre-malembo-dieu-du-carrefour-1943)
